comments: Theoretically, this sequence could be used to encode a given number of digits of Pi as a DNA sequence, which could then be read back from one helix. The value read back from the other helix would of course depend on the assignment of G, A, C, T to the digits 0, 1, 2, 3. - Alonso del Arte, Nov 07 2011
links: Francisco Javier Aragón Artacho, 100 billion step walk on the digits of pi
F. J. Aragon Artacho, D. H. Bailey, J. M. Borwein, P. B. Borwein, J. Fountain, M. Skerritt Walking on numbers: a multiple media mathematics project, 2012.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
